intro: Eriogonum ovalifolium var. deltoideum, commonly known as the delta buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its deltoid-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and sagebrush steppe. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, known for its ability to thrive in arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
